rgraph

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • rgraph.Node
      • rgraph.Module

  • public class Module
extends Node
    Represents a logical grouping of units, restricted to 4 units in version 1.0.

    A module is a logical grouping of a 2x2 set of nodes. This is the building block for all known reconfiguration algorithms as modules are a very helpful abstraction allowing movements that single units cannot accomplish on their own i.e. slides etc.

    Modules extend the class Node, as it is helpful to view modules as belonging to a graph representation of those modules.

    Since:
    2/14/2016

      • getSideUnits

        public java.util.List<Unit> getSideUnits(int dir)
        Gets a list containing the units on a side of the module.

        The list is ordered from left to right or from top to bottom (depending) on direction. This means that with two neighboring modules, side units can be matched up, and edges between modules are easy to create by iterating over side units.

        Parameters:
        dir - Indicates which side of the module to get. 0=North, 1=East, 2=South, 3=West
        Returns:
        List of Unit objects

      • getUnitsFrom

        public Unit[] getUnitsFrom(int dir1,
                           int dir2)
        Returns array of units from a starting quadrant, going in direction starting in dir1, and moving towards dir2.

        This method only applies for Module size of 2.

        Behavior when dir1 == dir2 or when dir1 == Direction.opposite(dir2) is undefined.

        Parameters:
        dir1 - Initial direction of sweep
        dir2 - Secondary direction of sweep
        Returns:
        array of units

      • getUnitInQuadrant

        public Unit getUnitInQuadrant(int dir1,
                              int dir2)
        Gets A unit given two directions determining the quadrent of the unit.

        This method only applies for Module size of 2.

        Behavior when dir1 == dir2 or when dir1 == Direction.opposite(dir2) is undefined. swapping the two direction parameters results in the same return value (as a symetric operation specifies the same quadrant).

        Parameters:
        dir1 - First direction vector
        dir2 - Second direction vector
        Returns:
        Unit from a quadrant of the module

      • addNeighbor

        public Edge addNeighbor(Module neighbor,
                        int dir,
                        boolean isExtended,
                        boolean isConnected)
        Adds a neighboring module in a specified direction, with extension and connection args
        Parameters:
        neighbor - Neighboring module to connect to
        dir - Direction of neighbor module
        isExtended - true if distance between this and neighbor is 1
        isConnected - true to connect modules
        Returns:
        the edge created

      • getExteriorSubEdges

        public java.util.List<Edge> getExteriorSubEdges(int dir)
        Returns a list containing all the exterior edges in a direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction of interest
        Returns:
        List of edges between units in that direction. Always supplied up to down or left to right.

      • getExteriorSubEdges

        public java.util.List<Edge> getExteriorSubEdges(Module neighbor)
        Returns a list containing all the exterior edges in a direction.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - Neighboring module of interest
        Returns:
        List of edges between units in that direction. Always supplied up to down or left to right.

      • getInteriorEdges

        public java.util.Set<Edge> getInteriorEdges(boolean vertical)
        Gets the interior edges either all horizontal or all vertical.
        Parameters:
        vertical - true gets vertical edges, horizontal otherwise.
        Returns:
        set of all edges in between units of the module in either the horizontal or vertical directions.

        public void swapUnits(Unit u1,
                      Unit u2)
        Swaps Units in the module array, useful for cleaning up after complicated movements, where units may be rearranged within the module.
        Parameters:
        u1 - First unit to swap
        u2 - Second unit to swap
